posts.post_content:
I'm looking to buy a $700k cnc machine for my business and have decided to sell my T206 collection to help keep the payments down. 

The set is 71% complete (approx 375 cards) Included is a magie error sgc 30, all other cards are graded 60 - 96 with quite a few being highest graded examples.

link to set:
[url]http://www.sgccardregistry.com/set.aspx?cat=1&set=239&userset=6302[/url]

I will Not sell individual cards or items at this time so please do not ask, I just don't have the time for scanning, emailing, and shipping them all. If there is no interest in the set as a whole i will be breaking it up and sending groups to various auction houses in the near future. 

I believe i have close to 200k invested. Going by psa's smr it adds up to 135k and thats not taking into acct backs or actual values of certain cards. For instance, i valued a lenox backed 5 the same as a piedmont 5. 

I am still working on coming up with a accurate number and will post it when i do. for the interim i will entertain and discuss offers from serious buyers. 

Thank You,
Kristopher J. Lill

Kris, No joke intended, I wish I had the money, so you could buy that machine, and you keep your cards. I hate to see your collection get split up and sold off, after all that hard work. You have built an amazing collection of cards. I have gotten quite a few of them on here and e-bay as you presumably upgraded cards. I wish you all the best with the sale. Hope you don't leave the hobby all together!!! Ralph
Delete (sorry didn't read the whole posting).
What type of CNC? I own a CNC job shop (turning and milling). Hope you get what you need to help with financing. Capital costs can be tough. Good luck!
